name: Albania
takeaway: Academic and cultural links, mainly supported and promoted through the Confucius Institute at the University of Tirana and the PRC Embassy in Albania, remain the most significant links between Albania and PRC, while there is no cooperation whatsoever of a military, law enforcement or strategic industrial and technological nature.

Although there is a parliamentary group in Albania, called "Parliamentary Friendship Group Albania-China", the interaction with PRC diplomats is minimal. In terms of foreign policy, Albania adheres to a "one Chine policy", has opposed the PRC’s territorial claim to the South China Sea, and has denounced publicly the human rights violations in Xinjiang, Hong Kong, and Tibet.

Compared to the period pre-2021, there is a decrease in visits to the PRC by Albanian journalists, influencers and also local government officials. These individuals are occasionally invited for cultural, academic or experience sharing visits, and are usually followed up by an article in PRC Embassy or other locally published PRC-sponsored media.

The PRC is the third-largest destination for Albanian imports, and also since 2016, the Chinese firm Geo-Jade Petroleum acquired the major concession for the major oil extraction field in Albania, however there is no other significant investment deriving from the PRC to Albania.
description-1: In 2023, Albania had a GDP per capita of US$8,368 and a total population of 2.82 million people.
description-2: Albania established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1949. Albania was ranked 99th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 68/100.

Media.evidence: Compared to years before 2021, in 2022, there is a decrease in visits from Albanian journalists and/or online influencers to PRC. Only one case was found. Therefore this Indicator, deserves a "Few" rating. The journalist involved is not widely known or relevant in Albania, therefore this indicator deserves a "Insignificant" rating.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Albania adheres to the "one Chine policy". However it is not widely publicized or mentioned in public discourse by Government officials. Therefore this Indicator deserves a "No" response.
Foreign Policy.note: Albania adheres to a one china policy, not the one China principle.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Albania has opposed the PRC’s territorial claim to the South China Sea. Therefore, Albania has rejected the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Albania has denounced in the UN the PRC’s treatment of Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang. Therefore, the Index country has denounced the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In 2020, the government of Albania signed on to a letter presented by several countries to the United Nations General Assembly that denounced the PRC’s treatment of citizens in Tibet, Xinjiang, and Hong Kong. Therefore, the Index country has denounced the PRC’s treatment of its Tibet population and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Albania was among a cross-regional group of 39 United Nations member countries issued a stinging public rebuke of the Chinese government’s widespread human rights violations in Xinjiang, Hong Kong, and Tibet in 2020. Therefore, the Index country has denounced the PRC’s imposition of the National Security Law on Hong Kong and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.”

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observationof the indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.note: In the past there have been a few memorandums signed between PRC entities and sub-national level entities on Albania, but none of the agreements has ever materialised. PRC Embassy continues to keep in touch with second-tier sub-national level entities in Albania.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Tirana has been city-twinned with Beijing since 2018. Earlier, in 2014 there have been talks between Durres and Ningbo officials in regard to twinning the cities, but no official document has been signed yet in this regard. However an agreement for friendly relationships and general cooperation has been reportedly signed in Ningbo in 2014. In 2015 Vlora was twinned with Yangzhou and in 2016 Fier was twinned with Lanzhou.  Therefore this Indicator, deserves a "More than a Few" rating. However, these twinning have not had any particular relevance, therefore this Indicator, deserves a "Insignificant" rating
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: In Albania, there is organized, on an annual basis, an event showcasing different nationalities, cultures and relationships with Albania. The whole event - the "Chinese Week" is held in Tirana annually, therefore this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, this activity is not really relevant in Albania, therefore this Indicator, deserves a "Insignificant" rating.

Society.evidence: The Chinese Embssy in Albania has donated materials to the Association of Disabled Persons of Albania. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: In November 2023 the Albanian National Channel (RTSH) has agreed to show the "Enchanting Beijing" documentary. There is a memorandum in place between PRC and RTSH in showing cultural documentaries from PRC in Albania, but the number of documentaries shown is rather minimal. Therefore this Indicator, deserves a "Few" rating. Also, since the RTSH is not among the highest viewed media, these documentaries are not widely publicized or relevant in Albania, therefore this Indicator, deserves a "Insignificant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: From 2019 to 2020, the share of respondents to the national Albanian Security Barometer survey who said China had a positive influence on Albania’s security more than doubled, from 23.5% to 54.9%. In 2022, with the question somewhat changed, 76.6% said they did not think China represented a threat to the security of Albania, compared with 19% who said it did. In Albania there is a lack of information about the PRC Governmnet, and PRC is rather perceived as a former "friendly country", due to past cooperation between Albania and China in the '70s. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes' response.
Society.note: PRC is seen by Albanians more in a cultural and historical light, rather than being understood in term of current Governance and political issues.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
